content:
Ninja Mini Mafia


Rules
Shamelessly stolen from Natirasha, with several edits from yours truly.

    0) Obey all site rules.

Gamestate
    1) Days are 14 days long, and nights are 48 hours long. I reserve the right to change this for whatever reason. Rest assured that if this actually happens, it's your fault.
    2) VOTE: Shinobi or Vote Shinobi are the only acceptable forms of voting. I will not count any attempts to vote that are not in one of those two formats. Unvotes are not required.
    3) A lynch is achieved when half of the living players, rounded down plus one have voted for a player. Once that event has happened, all votes are locked and twilight ensues.
    4) Once you're dead, you're dead. Please do not post anymore. If you were replaced out for whatever reason, please do not post in thread.
    5) If a majority is not reached at the end of the day, a no-lynch will be achieved. You have been warned.
    6) All night actions will be covered in your role pms. If you have questions in regards to your role, do not hesitate to ask me in private and I will resolve it ASAP.
    7) I will attempt to keep track of the deadline as often as I can. I will attempt to post the time in every votecount I give you. If I forget to do so or I decide not to for whatever reason, it is your responsibility to keep track.

Activity/Mod Actions
    1) I will prod a player after fourty-eight hours without posting. If a player accumulates three prods during a day or fails to respond to a prod in 72 hours, I will replace that player. Lurking is an acceptable tactic; it is up to the town to put a stop to it. If I get the feeling that you're simply not playing or are prod-dodging to waste a slot, I reserve the right to force-replace you.
    2) Prods will only be handed out starting 2 days from day start. If I feel you haven't responded to prods given earlier in a satisfactory way, I reserve the right to force replace you.
    3) If you need to go on V/LA for whatever reason, post in the thread in bold text. State the length of your V/LA; otherwise, it will be assumed that you will only be gone for 24 hours.
    4) You may not discuss the game outside this thread with other players involved in the game unless your role specifically says so. If you can, you may only discuss at the quicktopic listed to in your PM. You may have a 'rant buddy' who is outside the game, but I wish to be informed of their identity for replacement purposes. Don't abuse this.
    5) I am not responsible for your mistakes. If you screw up a tag or something, I will not edit it for you. If you have the ability to edit posts, please do not do so. I will not edit your posts for you.
    6) Avatars, titles, signatures, and your location are out-of-game areas.
    7) Please do not quote out-of-thread communications. Modkilling is something that I would prefer to avoid. Do not tempt my wrath.
    8) Although somewhat divine, I am prone to mistakes. If I miss anything, please PM me and I will resolve the issue as best as possible.
    9) I reserve the right to remove you if I feel you have crossed a behavioral line. If I do so, rest assured that you have shit the bed in a manner most foul.
    10) I reserve the right to change the rules at my own discretion. I will notify the thread if/when I do so.
    11) Don't make encrypted posts and don't try to pull the wool over my eyes. If I get the feeling that you're screwing with the rules or are playfully breaking them, you will be modkilled.

Important Note
    1) Bold green is my color. Do not tempt my wrath by using it. I'm watching you, town.

At least one player will receive this PM:

Role PM
Town
Rolename: Vanilla Town

You are town. You have the power of your voice and your vote. Help your fellow townies find and eliminate the mafia.

Win Condition (Town): You win when you eliminate every single anti-town faction left in play.

I'm not sure what a trust tell is actually...?

Trust tells are when you say something like,
"I only do X as this alignment"

For instance, for awhile, I was always claiming my alignment 100% truthfully.
This made the game unfair, because it grants a certain advantage but it also against scum wincon until the trust tell is broken.

The big difference from just falling into easy patterns and a trust tell, though, is that the trust tell is usually intentional and manufactured.
Like, if you went into every game and bolded your first post if you were town, and then called attention to the fact that you only bold first posts if you are town.
That sort of thing.

One of the critical points to look at is the opposing wagon situation.
Initially, the primary wagon opposite Thor’s was Allyra’s. Boonskies, Thor, and Konowa all resided on this wagon, and all seemed quite confident on it. When Allyra replaced out, Thor unvoted and switched to randommidget. A handful of posts later, Boonskies follows suit, and all of a sudden Thor has a new counter-wagon.

Zeb voting Allyra in 335 is weird, but it also doesn’t seem scummy to me at all. It doesn’t make sense from a scum-perspective to vote for someone like Allyra who most people seemed to be town-reading at the time, especially after the rage-quit.

Xiao in 387 mentions 3 people and comments on their potential alignment. Zebulin – Town. Me – Town. Varsoon – Unsure, but not playing typically. I don’t see him voting his one scum-buddy and calling out his other for weirdness here at the same time, so this makes Varsoon look better.

I had a game journal written up through the majority of Day 2, but most of that has been covered by other players either in obs or through in-game analysis and not much of what I wrote is worth noting at this point.

Town really did kind of kill itself this game, though. A couple of things to note:

Just because you think things aren't going your way, doesn't mean that the game is over when thread sentiment is against you. Zebulin actually had a bunch of huge advantages over killerjester in the finale; namely, that acryon trusted him over the only other possible lynch that day and the fact that he revealed the information he had as soon as he had it. I do feel like he got frustrated with being universally scumread for so long, and this is probably why he lost sight of the things that kept him in the game up to that point.

Associative reads do not make a good case. There are very few instances where one can link parts of a scumteam together, and voting together is certainly not among them, especially when two players are voting together on town when no mafiosos are up for lynch.

The trust-telling issue was being handled during Day 4. The listmods were getting involved by the time you guys lynched Boon, which actually made everyone's lives way easier. So there's a silver-lining, because we're not sure what the alternative would have been. The game being abandoned/cancelled was a real possibility.

It was a fun game to read through and I'm glad people enjoyed it. I'm going to start creating another setup, just in case anyone is interested.
